ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Cluster-Samba Waves of HF and Sounder for Probing Electron Density by Relaxation (WHISPER) Natural Electric Power Spectral Density
ResourceHeader.AlternateName: Cluster Samba WHISPER Electric Power Spectral Density under Natural Mode
ResourceHeader.Description: The Waves of HIgh frequency and Sounder for Probing of Electron density by Relaxation (WHISPER) performs the measurement of the electron density on the four satellites of the Cluster project. The two main purposes of the WHISPER experiment are to record the natural waves and to make a diagnostic of the electron density using the sounding technique. The various working modes and the fourier transforms calculated on board provide a good frequency resolution obtained in the bandwidth 2-83 kHz. Onboard data compression by the Digital Wave Processing (DWP) intrument allows a good dynamic and level resolution of the electric signal amplitude. Data products available from the Cluster Science Archive include: electric spectral power density (natural spectra and active spectra), electric spectral power density from passive emission during sounding, and electric waveform power density in 0.2 second resolution. Ancillary data include Quicklook plots (JPEG) in both active and natural mode, sounding times, housekeeping data, instrument parameters during natural and active mode, and active to passive spectral power density coded ratio. Access to data through the Cluster Science Archive is available via a java GUI interface and a command-line interface. Registration is required.

Parameter.Name: Delta
Parameter.Description: Delta. Half of the number of seconds corresponding to the sampling interval + the uncertainty of the time tags

Parameter.Name: Fast Fourier Transform Size
Parameter.Description: Number of bin frequency points of the Fast Fourier Transform

Parameter.Name: Electric Spectral Power Density
Parameter.Description: Electric Spectral Power Density in Natural Mode

Parameter.Name: Spectral Frequencies
Parameter.Description: Spectral Frequencies between 1.953 and 79.915 kHz, that is to say the frequencies corresponding point to point to the 512 elements of the fixed size spectrum

Parameter.Name: Overflow Code Value
Parameter.Description: This variable coded between 0 (no problem) to 1 (saturation) gives us an idea of the overflow value of the acquisition

Parameter.Name: Gain Change Number
Parameter.Description: Number of gain changes during the acquisition

Parameter.Name: Mantissa
Parameter.Description: First part of the compressed value which is a fixed point integer defined in the compression algorithm

Parameter.Name: Exponent
Parameter.Description: Second part of the compressed value
